website_summaries.verdict: A dual-band wireless router that works great for streaming HD-quality videos, playing video games and other bandwidth-intensive applications.,
pros: Includes gigabit wired connections that ensure fast transfer speeds
Equipped with external antennas for expanded coverage
Boasts 1 gigabit internet port and 4 gigabit Ethernet ports for added convenience
Default setup process is fast and easy
cons: May need to be restarted periodically to maintain a WiFi connection
Can be challenging to set up the router with private settings

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled by the Price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from this Tenda router because of how cheap it is. However, I was WAY wrong about that. :D Within 15 minutes of receiving it, I had the router set up and working beautifully. It's very easy to use! Also, after having it for several weeks now, I'm pleased to report that my network performance has never been better. I love that the dual band tech lets me set up dedicated networks for different device needs. I've put our smart tv's on the faster network to better accommodate streaming, and our computers/mobile devices are paired with the primary network. Being able to direct traffic this way, so to speak, has improved the overall user experience for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Six reasons for no one to ever buy this product. 1. It dropped my 1GB/s internet speed I pay for down to less than 100MB/s 2. It keeps disconnecting my wireless devices 3. After firmware update it won't let me connect any new wireless devices that weren't already connected before firmware update. 4. It only has 3 ethernet ports 5. It keeps randomly dropping the connection entirely to all my devices including the hard wired ones like my phillips hue bridge and my computer. 6. This uses the asus internals from the asus version of this which my dad had the asus version of this lock up on him. I would never recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: newraze

customer_reviews.title: ERRATIC AND UNSTABLE
customer_reviews.text: ERRATIC AND UNSTABLE, 6 of these and I've called it QUITS with Tenda. I install hundreds of routers every year from various manufacturers, many purchased by customers, most I purchase. This is NOT an issue of technical competence. I've run all the firmware updates since purchasing each unit. Various environments, power supplies replaced, programmed with different computers (no, not transferring some virus or something). They will lock-up, lose their settings, fail to pass data . These problems occur via wired and wireless modes. I would NEVER recommend this particular model to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Boosts Connection For Gaming
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little while to get it set up but once i did. I was happy I don't lag anymore even though I live with 14 people my connection is very stable my download speed went from 10 to 70 That's crazy I can live stream now while having discord open and playing an online game that's how good this things is this was worth my money
customer_reviews.author: SirTJ

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Love this inexpensive dual band router. You need a dual band if you plan on utilizing the highest speeds of your internet service and wanting to operate multiple devices at the same time. Very easy set up less than 15 minutes. Clear directions. Found the connection to be very reliable and 5 times faster than our previous router. We have multiple smart tvs running wifi, several devices and phones running simultaneously and service is very good. Download speeds on wifi are about 150 Mps and upload spreads are 25 Mps, but this will vary greatly depending on your internet service provider. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LawyerBae Renee

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome wait just a pile of plastic
customer_reviews.text: This item is very unstable after 30min of use it locks up and you lose signal i do not recommend i reset modem and router numerous times same issue never had issue with previous router i only wanted to upgrade and have a 5g router this turned into a nightmare i have alot of smart devices that control the lights in my home no wifi equals no light so now I'm just sitting in the dark thanks tenda I had high hopes when it was working it worked amazingly great transfer speed major con last only 30min then you unplug an plug in start all over again after doing this for the tenth time Today im done with this garbage
customer_reviews.author: michael kelly

customer_reviews.title: Tenda will never have a product in our House
customer_reviews.text: first unit wifi did not work at all, spent 1 hour online finding to get help ,spent another hour on phone to get reordered ,I was supposed to get the replacement yesterday day got Delayed So I went to Costco and found a faster better router A Nighthawk AX4300 $159.99 on sale 40dollars off , I tried to save money But It cost to much wasted time .I will return them both when the replacement comes ,Amazon`s product support is Not tech support But they try to be??!!
customer_reviews.author: Dannie D. Crowder

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Some devices would refuse to connect to this router. For instance,I have two 4k fire sticks. One connects and one does not. At first with the help of Amazon tech support we thought it was a bad firestick but when trying to connect the new replacement stick it still would not connect even after disabling any filtering and protection... Hooked up an old router and everything works.
customer_reviews.author: Josh W.

customer_reviews.title: Terminator Strong Signal!
customer_reviews.text: My old router of 6 years went bye bye on me. I browsed around on Amazon and this fit within my price range. Due to the current Covid-19, shipping was delayed but it actually arrived a day earlier than the expected date. The product was properly wrapped and not damaged. Instruction was clear for me to set up, and it was very short and precise. Not like the ordinary endless pages of instruction book (Thank goodness!) So far, the WiFi strength is very strong for our apartment (about 900 sq ft.) We have two laptops, two TVs, and we are constantly streaming. Highly recommend! If anything changes, will come back update!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Freshie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Unit
customer_reviews.text: I called and spoke to their tech, couldnt hardly understand him, all he said was it was a good unit, but could not fix the issue. Buy a better unit !!! I read what these other people write about this device, I have a lot of other routers much more expensive than this one, even several flashed with dd wrt, There is no way on earth this unit can dial up the transmitter more than dd wrt, look at what the FCC is trying to take off the market !!!!! Poor quality unit ! You get what you pay for !!!
customer_reviews.author: Nobody special

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because it was cheap, it has worked well for several years now.
customer_reviews.text: My use case was very specific so please keep that in mind for this review. This router has done a good job and I haven’t had very much trouble with it. This has been operating continuously for three years at my business. At most there are only two devices ever connected to this at a time so it is not exactly being used heavily. The main purpose of this was to allow me to wirelessly except credit card payments in my store. This was not used for gaming or streaming media. In the entire time that I have owned this router I have never had to do a firmware update or reboot it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Fast
customer_reviews.text: We have spectrum and they insist on charging you monthly to use their WiFi equippment. Our old modem/router combo was only pulling down 18 meg/sec, so I had spectrum deliver their modem (free!) and I got this as my wifi router. We are have 100 meg/sec internet service, and on the 5g band, this router is pulling down high 80's-low 90's in the two closest rooms. the regular band with about 50 or so, in nearly every corner of my house. So far I'm very happy with this. Only a week in, but assume no news here is good news!
customer_reviews.author: PTG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent setup, coverage, speed, and features all around!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for one thing, a fast, economical WiFi Router. What I got was not only three times the speed of the name brand wireless router it replaced, but setup was nearly effortless. The instructions with the product are clear and intuitive and the administrative controls are truly world class, with advanced firewall rules easy to access and modify. I was frankly not expecting this amazing level of features at such an affordable price point. This easily covers my entire house, but if it'd didn't I'd happliy pick up one or two more as range extenders too. Well done, Tenda!
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Great but for the wired connections, which are 10/100
customer_reviews.text: Look at this price-point there's basically nothing that competes with this router. I've used them in commercial installations and simply do not get trouble tickets. They run and run and it's fine. But BUT the wired LAN is 10/100, not gigabit. So please be careful if you're running a gigabit wired network. This is not going to be an appropriate router for you. Otherwise, if you're looking for solid WiFi, great coverage, and near-zero downtime, this is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Good router for any internet connection under 100mb/s
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a 3 bedroom townhouse. Our internet package offers 105mb/s and with this router, we are able to get 98 to 97 mb/s anywhere around the house. We also have some woods out back, and I am able to get good reception 70mb/s about 60 feet away from the router and through a wall. I've only turned the antenna strength up to medium for both the 2.4ghz and 5ghz channels. I would imagine it can reach farther on a higher power setting. Update: It has been a few years since that original review. The router still works great and UI is intuitive and nicely laid out.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: 100Mbps ports, really?
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this router is great for wifi signal strength but it has one major flaw: 100Mbps ports. I'm shocked that in 2019 anyone is still putting only 100Mbps ports on anything anymore. This means that if you have 100Mpbs or higher internet connection, you will be throttled to around 70Mbps, if you're lucky. 1Gbps should be the standard on everything and don't try to hide the slow ports by saying 'fast LAN ports.'
customer_reviews.author: EbodMcGee

customer_reviews.title: No more lag!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this wireless router. It was relatively inexpensive and it really helped to improve my family's WIFI experience. Prior to purchasing this router, when my son was playing on his video games and my wife and I were trying to stream a movie...we all experience a lag or interruptions all together. This device greatly improved our whole house WIFI. I don't write many review, but I feel this product desired one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast Wifi not gigabit Ethernet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this device when I upgraded my home internet service from DSL to Cable. The Wifi speeds and coverage of this device were very good, but I apparently misread the description when they talked about gigabit speeds, as you can't achieve anything near that off of this router, due to the fact that it only has 100Mbit Ethernet jacks! My mistake, and luckily Amazon has an easy return policy. I ended up buying a newer version of the AC1200 from Tenda that has gigabit Ethernet ports. I actually like the web user interface on this older device better than that on my new one....
customer_reviews.author: James Evans

customer_reviews.title: Works great, painless to setup.
customer_reviews.text: My main need was a wifi router with range, I bought one four times as expensive and it barely covered a quarter of my house. This thing blankets my entire home in 2.4g without the need for repeaters and the 5g stretches as far as expected. The setup -- naming the network, assigning new passwords, it was all easy, straightforward, and painless. Speeds are all stable and reliable. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Apost

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend. P.I.T.A.
customer_reviews.text: Drops WAN connection constantly, requires a total off-on reboot any time it's been sitting more than 12 hours. The user interface is "clunky" if I'm being kind and puzzling all the time. You cannot manage the device with the app when it drops the WAN connection, so you have to set up a secondary login process. Says there's a firmware update available until I start to update it, then there isn't. I will not recommend this to anyone. Too bad, because when the thing works the signal is great throughout with even, high-speed coverage. Not worth the savings. Buy a better router from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: N. Baerreis

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to setup and the wifi is fast
customer_reviews.text: Set this up for my sister-in-law in her condo after complaining about slow wifi speeds with her AT&T Uverse Internet. They give you a really old wifi router hoping you purchase an upgrade. Just plugged this router into one of the ethernet ports on the AT&T router, use the app to configure this router which automatically detected the type of Internet connection, change the default wifi network name, and passwords. Probably took about 5 minutes and the wifi network provided by this router is so much faster. At less than $40, it is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: pcguy63

customer_reviews.title: Made it possible for me and another tenant to share wifi!
customer_reviews.text: I share wifi with my downstairs neighbor and my 3 year old Linksys router was just not getting very good coverage or speeds. I was doubtful of whether or not a $30 router would solve the issues, but we are not getting advertised speeds and there are no more dead zones in my apartment! Since the router is downstairs, I love having the Tenda app available on my phone so I can troubleshoot problems without needing to go to my neighbor's apartment. Solving interference issues is a breeze! I love this thing and I highly recommend it. Probably the best bang you can get for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Chaucer

customer_reviews.title: Older router was performing better than the Tenda
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by this wireless router. My WD Net N600 had more bandwidth speed. I was using the Wan port connected to my FiOS ONT. I have 200mbps upload and download and when using this Tenda wireless router, it only went as high as 120mpbs. I had to return it since it was underperforming. The WD router however was running openwrt. I did not install openwrt on this Tenda router but what may me not proceed was how the wan port was not able to get the full speed my other router was doing and also the range was not as powerful despite having 4 external antenna whereas my WD router had no external antennas
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos

customer_reviews.title: No tech support at all
customer_reviews.text: There is no tech support at all. I called the toll free numbers printed on the small piece of paper 5 times, paper shows 24/7 tech support. No one answers, the call ends without even an option to leave a message. I was very lucky when I decided to try my internet service provider, Xfinity. The guy was so nice and so helpful. Xfinity is great! Stay away from Tenda, which offers no support at all. Update: Today 20 Oct. It stops working. Their website is down also. Stay away from the junk. I don't think Amazon should carry it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Rong Liang

customer_reviews.title: Need more power?
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't get an internet signal in the front part of our house ever since moving in 4 years ago. So I went out on a limb and purchased this router. It is AMAZING! Now we have an internet signal throughout our house. With the 4 antennae on board this ship, you can direct the signal to where you need it most. You will not be sorry for this purchase. Just Do It!! Thank me later...
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Murphree

customer_reviews.title: Neutral!
customer_reviews.text: The signal stays stable for the most part, but it disconnects from time to time. The manual did not have useful info that matches the product. Most of the info is outdated, the set up links don't work, and the customer support was not answering calls and when there answers were not professional. I think if this company that is aiming to compete in the market, they should be more professional.
customer_reviews.author: Masinissa

customer_reviews.title: Love our new Tenda
customer_reviews.text: We were having trouble getting Prime as our router is several rooms away from the tv. The Tenda router seemed to be the right choice. We tried to install it ourselves but we are in our late 70's and not as computer literate as our grandkids. I called their customer support and got Udid. He was very helpful getting us hooked up. I had to call back because I couldn't figure out how to get it back after turning my computer off. I left a message and Udid recognized my number and called me right back. I felt he went above and beyond and was very gracious.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very slow.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up....thats about all good about it. Very unstable performance. Our modem delivers about 400Mbps measured with ethernet cable. While connected to Tenda router and again checked with wired connection from router the signal dropped to miserable 90Mbps. It means that router consumes somehow over 75% of signal. While measuring WiFi signal it drops another 50% which means speeds about 45Mbps, and that's within only about 10ft from Tenda unit. Overall performance or should I say rather lack of it very disappointing. Stay away, there are better choices out there.
customer_reviews.author: gregMo

customer_reviews.title: Takes the signal from the Modem and makes it weak
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade my intenet to 200mbps, so I needed a router for the wifi to be in 200mbps too... I decided to buy this because it's supposed to be able to handle those speeds... HOWEVER, as i configured it and plugged it in, my internet speed went down af. Wired speed goes to a max of 90mbps, while if connected directly to the moden gives me the 200mbps. Wireless is a joke. 5Ghz gives me a ridiculous speed of 2mbps at max. 2.4 ghz gives me a max of 50mbps... I've tried resetting it multiple times, changing channels, configuring differently... anything. And nothing works. Avoid this router if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Chiky

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and long range
customer_reviews.text: I use this to run wireless Internet to shop that is about 75 feet from my house. I bought 150 foot ethernet cable and ran it from the modem in the house through the attic And across a telephone line to the shop. The set up only took a couple of minutes and the range covers the entire 1 story 1500 square-foot shop and 30 (60ft +diameter) feet into the parking lot even though it sits at one end of the shop and not centrally. Setting up the password was easy too. I would recommend this router to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: no way to set ip addresses
customer_reviews.text: you can change the range it defaults from 100 to 200 but you cannot change to match previous router so will be required to refresh all wired devices to match new configuration i have also not been able to figure out port forwarding but with new devices port forwarding is no longer required but if you have an old surveillance system that requires static ip and port forwarding in order to function then you may have a problem but even with this issue this router functions very well once configured to your network
customer_reviews.author: edward avila

customer_reviews.title: Solid multi-network router with a great combination of simplicity and customizability
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup quickly, yet still has full configurability options (although you have to look for them a bit). It can create 3 wifi networks (one normal, one 5GHz, and one guest) which can be a little confusing at first, but is actually very useful in the long run. Also very nice is that you can toggle between lower and higher signal strengths for each network. Because my router is two stories beneath my office computer, I needed to select the higher signal strength, but this resulted in a much stronger and more reliable signal than my previous router.
customer_reviews.author: NBSteve

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi, but no gigabit eathernet?
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by saying that the wireless signal and speed are every bit what the description makes it out to be. This router was extremely easy to setup, even in my unusual network config. HOWEVER something that is not made clear is the 4 ethernet posts (1 WAN/ 3 LAN) are NOT gigabit! They are 10/100 ports! This is only really a problem when using a wired connection. As a wireless repeater it works perfectly. Fast speeds, reliable connection, and again, SUPER easy setup! If you're looking for a cheap wireless extension, this is DEFINITELY a great buy! However, if you're looking for a primary router or wired extension, this will only help you up to 100 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Colbie

customer_reviews.title: Great Router for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was a super Router for the money however it would not connect to our Security camera system. We tried everything and as an IT professional I mean everything but the cameras or the system would not connect. Honestly not sure what the issue was but for the majority of people this is an excellent Router. You can't beat the price, It was super fast and covered our 3000sf home without any dead spots. Setup is easy for the novice and I would recommend it to others. Tenda is a great company and their Tech support is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Great Customer

customer_reviews.title: no customer services, no firmware updates.
customer_reviews.text: When it is working, it is a "nice" router, however, if you have any kinda of problem be ready: there is not a customer service at all. I dropped 3 emails: to the first one I obtained an almost automatic reply, whereas the other 2 emails were completely ignored. The lack of support is reflected even on the firmware updates: indeed, the firmware seems to be NOT updated in a timely manner/at all (e.g. the real important issue concerning the wpa2 security has not been fixed yet and even if I tried in different occasions to ask if it was planned any soon to get this problem fixed, again, I was completely ignored. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Stefano

customer_reviews.title: ★ REROUTING YOU TO TP-LINK ★
customer_reviews.text: Tech Support for Tenda does not exist. Once you receive their product in the mail, there is no way of contacting Tenda on instructions on using their products that do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Comeaux

customer_reviews.title: Not As Described
customer_reviews.text: My Service plan includes 300MBPS I contacted my provided and tenda tech support said I need addition wifi extenders and that the router itself can only get about 100 mbps. I rebooted and ran multiple speed test highest ive got was 54mbps. was no satisfied tenda tech support said they are changing how they promot the AC6 router because it doesn't reachthe speeds it advertises.. Returned item immediately
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Speed and conductivity are fine. What I've noticed
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for a few months, no issues. Speed and conductivity are fine. What I've noticed, compared to my old (long range) router I have fewer drop and faster reconnect when cutting the grass. Real world range, better than 100 ft. I don't remember having to reset it yet and having a "guest" Wi-fi is pretty cool. Software is user friendly and set up is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: kearnsboo

customer_reviews.title: AC1200 only gives you 100mbps
customer_reviews.text: I called the support line, the AC1000 only gives you 100 mbps, said not to pay attention to the data rate and only look at the interface specs on their home page and said the Amazon specs are wrong. I could hardly understand the tech support agent. This router is useless and will be thrown away since I am past their 30 day return policy. I am getting around 350 mbps speed going into the router and less than 100 mbps second on the WAN, 2.4 and 5G coming out.
customer_reviews.author: nkinnir

customer_reviews.title: No Tech Support; 2.4Ghz Signal Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Pros: relatively easy set up and the 5Ghz signal was great and worked fine. Cons: The 2.4Ghz signal did not work (which is what most of my in-home devices run on). I emailed, called, and chatted in to customer service (multiple numbers/emails) over a dozen times over the course of two weeks. Amazon support couldn't figure out the issue either after hours trouble shooting. I finally bought a new router and then got a missed call from the manufacturer from a random number on a Saturday evening saying they could help if I tried to contact them again - not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup and very good range.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I live in a trailer on my sister's property and her WiFi signal does not carry out to my equipment, by setting this unit up in her garage the signal reaches out to my trailer quite easily and I'm getting 2 bars on the 5G band and 4 of 5 bars on the 2.4G band ant there was no signal at all without this device. Small problem of the ISP supplied router not reconnecting to it after it's maintenance cycle about every 4 days but I believe this to be a router problem and not the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Perry Sr

customer_reviews.title: Never even got it to work
customer_reviews.text: After hours trying to get this router to work on our own, we tried to get ahold of customer support. That should not have been so difficult. We finally got through to them three days later and spent an hour and fifteen minutes repeating the same steps over and over with no success. This router would not connect to our modem...not at all. The tech person spoke very broken English and kept telling us "no big deal" when he took us to an unsecure site. yes sir, that IS a big deal. It is packaged up and waiting to be returned tomorrow. One thing is certain, we will not be purchasing from Tenda again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie C.

customer_reviews.title: Signal is terrible; nothing but trouble since day purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Since day 1, I have had issues with this product. The signal is intermitent at best. Now, I hardly have any ability to use my Wi-Fi throughout the apartment without unplugging, waiting and plugging again - only to have WiFi fail. Only reliable place is my office where the router is located. This is crazy! One solution would be to reset the router, of course. But I am unable to do so. No matter how many times I press the reset button or how long I press it, the router will not reset to factory settings. I do not recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works great with FIOS
customer_reviews.text: I am using this router with FIOS and it works great. Even the technician who came to install the WIFI was surprised by how strong the signal was in all the rooms. I work from home 1 or 2 days per week and have conference calls with Europe and Asia and the quality of the sound and image is always great. Very happy with my purchase as it is working great at a fraction of the cost of the Verizon router.
customer_reviews.author: VBM

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this router, it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I have 75 Mbps internet but with a cheap 2.4 Asus router I was only getting 30 and my wife's iPhone 11 was really slow, so I bought this and with 2.4 I get 70 Mbps and on the 5 I get 90 Mbps and the iPhone works great on either band. Weird that with my other router I only got 30 when it was supposed to be good for 100. So if u have the same problem this cheap router worked for me. Thank you to the seller for the cheap price because I am kind of poor and it really helps.
customer_reviews.author: -A

customer_reviews.title: Just bought a second one because it was so easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: fantastic interface with parental controls, scheduled sleep mode (but only one schedule - so you have can choose only certain days or all days, but only ONE period of time). Easy and intuitive app also. Two minor criticisms, 1. can only have one sleep program and 2. the wifi password and the router password nomenclature is confusing in the first set up screen so I always get the passwords reversed.
customer_reviews.author: Wells Turnage

customer_reviews.title: Does not seem to want to stay over 100mbps
customer_reviews.text: I saw other reviews about this issue but ignored it as I assumed they probably just received a defective product but after plugging this in and adjusting the settings every which way (changing the channel, channel width, security, QoS, etc.) I could not seem to get it to transmit over 100mbps. During speedtests, it would seem to want to go over the 100mbps but always ended up below. Also, hardwired did show speeds up to 900mbps. Maybe I got the same defective product as the others with this issue and we are just playing return/refund musical chairs with this same router.
customer_reviews.author: Angel S.

customer_reviews.title: Spectrum Router is Better. Would Not Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the router I rent from Spectrum. The Spectrum router is far superior. I have two levels and the WiFi on this router has trouble in every room that is not the room that it sits in. The internet hardly works in the lower level of my house, whereas it works just fine with the Spectrum router. The wifi signal doesn't even reach my bedroom, which is a straight shot down the hallways from where the router sits. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DJR

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I had a weak WiFi signal so I purchased the Tenda AC1200 router to hopefully fix the issue. It didn't help much at all over the stock cable router that I had. Even with its 4 antennas and all the hype specs the measured speeds and range were no better than before. I even exchanged it for a new one to see if the one I was using was defective, but no it wasn't. I'd say I don't recommend it, save your money. Their support is non existent! There's a toll free support number that when you call it, it goes to a voice mailbox that's always full!
customer_reviews.author: BOB_NJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor replacement for FIOS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my FIOS router instead of paying $12/month for the Verizon Quantum router because the price is great, but it did not successfully connect to the Internet. I called Technical Support and they helped me get it to connect successfully using the Verizon ONT, but as soon as we were off the phone it lost the Internet connection again. I am not impressed with the reliability of something that doesn't work for 5 minutes. Maybe I just got a bad unit, but I think I will try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Sparx

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult to setup must be tech smart
customer_reviews.text: Was difficult to setup initially so if your not tech smart I would not recommend unless you want to call tech support. Directions are vague. Few pics with explication. I don’t like calling tech support or reading directions much but I am tech smart. There are simpler ways to setup a router. I got this because of the price which was cheap and the strength which is strong also because more than one person streams on the WiFi so that’s why I got a dual band. Stores charge too much even Walmart was expensive
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: The LAN ports failed
customer_reviews.text: The LAN ports on the back of the router failed and caused it to deliver nearly zero Wifi signal. I unplugged all hard wired connections and the Wifi signal is working just fine. There must be something screwed up internally with the router. It worked one day and didn’t the next with no changes to the configuration. Fortunately, the wired connection devices are also able to connect via Wifi. Disappointed, but at least I had a work around.
customer_reviews.author: Netts

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy.
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't work. So I recently went with a different ISP and my speeds were raised from 100 down/ 25 up to 200/200. Well this router can't handle it. Via 5 GHz it would make it at 95mbps down and the same up. Even over Ethernet it was the exact same deal. Received a zyxel router from the ISP and the problem disappeared. Is just stay away from these off name brands. Besides you don't know what sort of spyware is inherent in this router being it's off brand and made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible latency during downloads
customer_reviews.text: (This review is for the Tenda AC-9 model) It has a nice interface and everything seemed to be working well, but as soon as anyone in the house starts to download anything, everyone's latency shoots up from the normal 40ms to 300ms or above. Every time. Put my 5-year-old cheapo router back on and suddenly everything's back to normal. Latency goes up by maybe 10ms during a heavy download. I'm giving two stars for the interface and because a household that only streams won't notice the problem, so it could be usable for someone. Not me, though. I'll be returning it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: E. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Great Reliable Router, work well with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup, increased my Wifi speed from 10 MBPs to 90 MBPs. I use it with an xfinity modem in bridge, and the xfinity Aries modem was putting out a very poor signal. By adding this router I increased the speed almost 10 fold, (75 MBPS Xfinity Internet) and Wifi coverage area is also much improved. Has more features than you would expect at this price point, including Beamforming, 3 wifi networks 2.4 ghz and 5 ghz as well as guest network with dedicated credentials. Havent looked at it since hooking up some time ago, hasn't missed a beat. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jankuc

customer_reviews.title: Wifi range not great
customer_reviews.text: I found the router to be good if I am working from the same room. However, not great if I am in a different room. I would recommend getting a wifi network booster for additional rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Souvik Sarkar

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent signal
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for the first couple of weeks that I owned it. However, after a while the internet would keep dropping. The modem was providing a strong signal for the router, but the router was not working at all. It had a signal, but the signal it gave off had no internet whatsoever even though the modem was working. At first I thought it was a fluke but it kept happening over and over and over which resulted with me only having access to the internet for 6 out of 7 days every week. Really disappointing and I would definitely not recommend this brand at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap! Great Range! Amazing features!
customer_reviews.text: Great Range! Amazing features! a dual band router with 2G / 5G band. I was specifically looking for a cheap router with "Bandwidth Control" and the setup/interface is easy. I can put how much Download/Upload speed one device can use. It's essential because me and my brother does online gaming a lot and when someone uses streaming we lag. I must say though that im not a fan of the bubble design, but it's not worth removing a star because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Silvermaine

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: Solved all of our WiFi dropouts from using the At&t provided DSL modem/router. Easy setup. Came with all the cables needed to quickly be up and running. This was added to our modem port and onboard WiFi was then handled using this product. Creates 2 WiFi spots 1 - 2g. 1 - 5g Each can have own name / password and has option for guest accounts for up to 24 hours if you want to share access without sharing private passwords.
customer_reviews.author: J Lane

customer_reviews.title: Best router I ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I have had dual band routers before, this however is the best by far. I won’t go into the technical details as I’m sure there are many other reviews that have done that exhaustively well already. What I will say however is that I get wired speeds using the 5Ghz band up to 30 feet away before I get any kind of loss. The 2.4Ghz band is cast far enough that my ENTIRE property is now wifi accessible. This thing works.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Great Router and Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router for a 1 or 2 bedroom apartment. I recently moved and switched internet providers but had issues when trying to resetup the router. I called Tenda support and Manish answered on the 3rd ring. He was really helpful and walked me through all the steps of resetting and restarting my router and modem until it was working. He was patient, understanding, and knowledgeable. I wish I would have called in sooner instead of spending a few days trying to troubleshoot it myself! I’m so happy that I have internet now and don’t have to buy a new router!!

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Impressed! I was able to double my signal compared to my old router and boost 5ghz signal to my entire home without having a drop in speeds. We run multiple devices, about 8, at a time. The wifi signal doesn't loose a beat even when the ps4 is directly connected via Ethernet. Very easy set up, since instructions were not included in my box, it only took me like 5 minutes
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: The company's concept of Tech Support is extremely poor; lots of luck!
customer_reviews.text: A gross disappointment in Technical Support, I was on the phone for 45 minutes, trying to enunciate correctly, so that the techie could understand me--because I could only make out a few words that he said to me. The product is adequate, I think--it is hard to tell so far--but, that caused the 2 stars; otherwise, I might have given it ZERO stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Ledford

customer_reviews.title: Didn't boost signal much, slowed speed, as expected. Overall no-go.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to boost signal from an old Apple Time Capsule router (used to extend my primary network via ethernet linkage) to an outdoor Nest camera. Before repeater, signal was borderline, upload speeds were variable, 5-12 Mbps. Was concerned signal might drop intermittently. Plugged in this extender at multiple sites between the two, tweaked antenna position, etc. Best signal I could get was a little bit better than without, but the expected decrease in speed with this wi-fi repeater resulted in speeds of 2-9 Mbps and choppy image transmission. In the end, I moved some things around so I could reposition the router by a couple of feet and gained far more signal strength and speed than with the repeater.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: NOT USEFUL FOR AN ON DEMAND FEATURE!!!! VERIZON FIOS ESPECIALLY.
customer_reviews.text: Is NOT COMPATIBLE, I repeat NOT COMPATIBLE with (VERIZON FIOS ON DEMAND) SO if you do indeed see works w/Verizon FiOS, it will, but just doesn't work with the (ON DEMAND) FEATURE, SO I Didn't find this out until way after the 30 days return was due. So I'm out $40+.00.. THE TRUTH MATTERS... DO NOT PURCHASE if YOU use the (ON DEMAND FEATURE) Purchase an older VERSION of the VERIZON FIOS ROUTER REBURBISHED or not. Your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre Pietrowski

customer_reviews.title: This is only supporting up to 100 Mbps....not fast and no info at the web & box
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect more than 100 Mbps for wired and wireless speed. I have internet speed upgraded to 300 Mbps and then realized this. Called the customer service and he said this supports upto 100 only not 300, 800, or 1000 wireless rate which is different than the speed we are normally referring. They don't intentionally put this info so customers like me are buying this and expecting better speed. Therefore, stay away if you expect more than 100 Mbps.... They don't do any for me since I bought this more than a month ago..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Using as a wireless bridge
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a few months now as a WISP access point and as a client/repeater - basically I extend my wireless to a wired network where I have my TV equipment. For some time it would frequently lose its wireless connection to the main router, and would just become a standalone network until I rebooted it. I turned of the 2.4GHz wireless and changed the 5GHz wifi bandwidth setting to 40. After that it has been stable. Speed is good and I'm really happy to have it finally working reliably.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Reader

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE AVOID AT ALL COSTS
customer_reviews.text: CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!!! Product provides false advertising!!! The box does not tell you that it will ONLY provide internet speed of 100mbps. I have 200mbps internet spectrum service and this AC6 says it will give you up to 300mbps via 2.4GHz and 867mbps via 5G. Spectrum came out to my house today and said this router will not support speeds of over 100mbps. I talked to Tenda customer service and they confirmed that this router, even though it is advertised as 300mbps via 2.4GHz and 867mbps via 5G, will not support over 100mbps. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Downey

customer_reviews.title: DSL modem NOT INCLUDED!
customer_reviews.text: This router was listed in with the DSL modem/routers causing a false purchase because it does NOT include a modem it is strictly a router and does not work with the old at&t DSL. I waited a week for delivery only to find its useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Cash

customer_reviews.title: Works but doesn’t reach very far
customer_reviews.text: I think I like it. I can watch Netflix and other streaming stuff but it doesn’t always connect well. I live by myself in a 900 sq ft apt. Sometimes it has trouble reaching my bedroom that is 20 ft away from the router. Not sure what the issue is.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie s

customer_reviews.title: Great Router for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good router and for the price it cannot be beat. I have been very pleased with it. Installation took just a couple of minutes. The instructions were ok, but could be better. I did not have to use tech support and I found the administrator interface to be very easy to navigate and intuitive. This is a larger router than I am used to, but other than that, I am very pleased and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: dfischer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: My netgear that cost 19.99 from Walmart that was like 4 years old worked better than this thing. We lose internet at least once a day since installing this one and jeez is it slow!!
customer_reviews.author: Kassy

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: I had to get this for the dual band in order to connect a baby monitor and robot vacuum that couldn’t be on the 5g network. I was certainly not going to pay to rent from the cable company. It took a little longer than expected to set up because there was additional steps involved but I got it done on my own and everything hooked up. I was hoping for a better signal than I had before but it is still the same.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Bona fide piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I received this about noon and hooked it up with tech help. It was easy. I was up and running. Ah, but about an hour later, it was connected, but no internet. I called tech support. They got me running again. Repeat those last 3 sentences again and again. It is now 8pm and I'm calling it quits. It works briefly - if then. Piece of junk - but at least it was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jann Howell

customer_reviews.title: Parental website blocking doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The parental website blocking doesn't work. Instructions claim you can enter the name of a website like youtube and it will be blocked. Not true, nothing happens. Tried full names, partial names, with https, wth www, with dot extensions. Nothing gets blocked. Totally bogus. Aside from that the router works fine but not the website blocking feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not do port forwarding of a range!?!
customer_reviews.text: The router hardware works fine- but the software is utter trash. The main thing you need to ask yourself when buying this is if you need to do any kind of port forwarding, because this router can't do it. Do not try to do the following things with this router: Game, remote access, wifi file transferring, server hosting It has good signal with pretty good speed passthrough, but it's a moot point if the ports you need can't be opened
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Inop
customer_reviews.text: I did not get around to installing it until after 30 days. The return button is now gone. I guess I am out of the return time. Went to Best Buy bought a Netgear and super easy to install. Everything is working great. Netgear AC1750 is the way to go. When we originally tried to install the Tenda I did not believe it was bad. My son tried today with their tech support and it is bad. So, it is headed to a landfill near me.
customer_reviews.author: DirectGlenn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good! Nice Price.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried as I read some pretty bad reviews after I purchased it. But it got here and I am liking it a lot. Has great, solid signal on both 2.4GHz and 5GHz. Very nice GUI with plenty of options. Even has a companion app. For $35 bucks, it's pretty solid. Very pleased with this router. Note: I live in a larger apartment, 1 story, so I can't vouch for upstairs and downstairs signal.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian heredia

customer_reviews.title: Great AC1900 router for less!
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of Tenda, but decided to go with them and am very pleased. This is a nice router, with a decent interface. Better than some of the name brands. Setup was not only easy, intuitive as well. Be nice to have some lights on the 4 ethernet ports, but I guess that is where they save some of the money.
customer_reviews.author: BecksWhip

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: This router has a good wifi signal and works, but the issues I have with it are the cyber security vulnerabilities that remain and are not mitigated. If you google this router you will see it listed and the vulnerability that puts all of your connected devices at risk. For that reason alone, I recommend you pass on this router, the risk alone far outweigh any cost savings. I would recommend you stick with the big names that offer regular firmware updates to address vulnerabilities as they are discovered.
customer_reviews.author: Ares240

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform at speeds advertised
customer_reviews.text: After installing the Tenda AC1200 router on to my network and preforming multiple tests, I determined the router was not capable of delivering speeds as advertised (advertised as up to 1GB on 5G). On my 150mb connection I was never able to get above 90mb through this router. I returned the Tenda immediately and invested in an alternate product which I have already had significantly more success with.
customer_reviews.author: JTKichline

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with the buffering issues while watching sling TV. Change two different routers with no resolve. While researching, I came across MIMO routers. Tenda was 1/4th price of other routers so I bought it. Easy setup. Buffering stops immediately. Saw 50% increase in 2.4 GHz speed. 5G was the same. It has options where you can turn off signals at particular time. I would advise to turn off WiFi signal at night time when it’s not in use to avoid possible radio wave radiation . Works same like other big brands but less than half the price. Very happy 😃
customer_reviews.author: Karim

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: works, but was a bitch to setup. Not my first router, it's like they made it a PIA to get it going.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless Tenda Router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Tenda AC-1200 router used from Amazon Warehouse. My first surprise was the missing instructions manual. The router was already configured by previous user. No way to reconfigure and connect with my devices. A waste of time and money. Please refrain from buying Tenda items from Amazon Warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Solo

customer_reviews.title: It works great, I also run 2 chromecasts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about 2 months ago, It has not gave me a single problem. The admin panel is very well organized, I work online and have to do Mac address changes a few times daily to update and change my IP with what I do. It works great, I also run 2 chromecasts, 3 laptops, multiple tablets phones, and 2 desktops(wired). I list this to show what I have put this router thru. I recommend it, for the decent price, overall design of the unit, and its functionality. I could of went with a cheaper version but I liked the design.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick X

customer_reviews.title: Tenda Tech Support very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Shubham from Tenda was very helpful in tech support. After spending the weekend without internet and having to buy a new modem. No one was able to help me reconnect my Tenda router, then on Sunday, Shubham did it in 20 minutes. Yea! Just keep calling. Their message implies they are there business hours but they are there on eves and weekends, too. Ps. the router has very good range.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Security
customer_reviews.text: Not secure, keep having to change password and Mac addresses. At least once a week I’m notified of an unauthorized access. I glad that I get alerted but then I have to shutdown until I get home. Then I’m tasked with connecting everything all over again with a new password.
customer_reviews.author: Prometheus04

customer_reviews.title: Zero to Running FAST in under 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: SIMPLE, EASY, Works SUPER FAST. I got this as an Access Point for a section of our house that has been a notorious dead zone. This thing lights up the entire neighborhood. Seriously, everything upstairs runs as fast (or seems to) as hard wired ethernet. I had it setup and running in under five minutes. If you are a geek and want a lot of settings to play with, this is not for you. If you want to set this thing up FAST without any problems and have it working like a champ, then this is for you. We said good-bye to buffering YouTube and Netflix applications.
customer_reviews.author: DLM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Router for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have never heard of this brand and needed something cheap to get me by until my current router is returned.I have a NETGEAR Nighthawk Pro Gaming Router that I sent in for warranty repair. That thing was great. But this cheap router from Tenda has been Awesome. I mean wow for the price. My Netgear has been returned and I still have not hooked it back up. It has been 3 months and this thing has only been reset 1 time with no issues. I am going to put it up and I know I will have a good backup.
customer_reviews.author: Ken McClellan

customer_reviews.title: It worked for five months.
customer_reviews.text: And then something happened, and it messed up all the wifi in the house. I can't return it since it's been five months, but I paid $32 for it and I am so angry it's already broken. I was without internet for THREE WEEKS because I didn't realize it was this stupid router that was malfunctioning. UGGGHHHHHHH!
customer_reviews.author: Pinky Torres

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work - No technical support
customer_reviews.text: Was able to set this router up. I try to follow the instructions online and in the manual: To no avail I then contacted technical support in which I heard nothing back from! I called their office and I heard nothing back.. (Perhaps the virus?) still not sure what was wrong with my unit if it was defective or if I simply overlooked something, But in my disappointment I returned the device and got a refund((Thanks Amazon&sorry!))
customer_reviews.author: Noah Aaron V

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of routers. I use them for customers in my work.I have used many brands of routers. I have used expensive routers and cheap routers. I can honestly say that this is the best router I have ever tried. Just buy it and try it for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ewing

customer_reviews.title: great for a small apartment
customer_reviews.text: The product works great in a 1200 sq.ft apartment. previously my wife and I had a router with only a 2.4 GHz band which for those of you who don't know straight up doesn't work in an apartment building. The airwaves are just too crowded to maintain a consistent signal. This thing works wonders with the 5 GHz band meaning we get strong and consistent connection on both our phones and laptops all at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Loses 50% of speed
customer_reviews.text: The fastest speed available at my house is 15Mbps. If I run a speedtest on the line before my router, I actually get 15Mbps or very close. If I plug in the router and test the speed, it drops to 8.08. Tenda customer support says this is normal and the same for all routers. I told them I've never before had a router that cut my speed in half. They said sorry, but they were unable to further assist me.
customer_reviews.author: SusannaBee

customer_reviews.title: Only good for 100mbps
customer_reviews.text: Did some digging and found out that the wan port. Or the port you plug in to from your modem is 10/100 port. Meaning it only allows 100mbps of data in at a time. So if you have a plan that exceeds 100mbps you won't be able to take advantage of it whether your wired for on wirless. Witch is weird send they bost more the 800 mbpt over wifi. So only good if you plan on getting 100mbps or less
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: We got this because out old router kept dropping the signal. This is fantastic for the price. It has not dropped once in the past few months we have it. And it was far cheaper than the other ones we were looking at. We regularly stream music (in video format), movies, and pretty high data games (on a tablet) at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Ooo Shiny

customer_reviews.title: I'm GLAD I got this!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is Awesome for the price. Honestly you can't get better. I build computers so for me installation was super easy, but even if you're a novice it's easy to set up and get going, just follow the directions. Like I said, for the price you just can't get better. The router looks really nice too, it kinda looks like the B2 Stealth Bombers. Wifi coverage is really good too, I'm getting max signals from where I couldn't before. Get it, you won't be disappointed. Thanks seller for the Super Speedy Delivery and Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Deo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Router
customer_reviews.text: Waited to post this review. The Tenda 1200 router has proven to be one of the best on the market today. You can interact with this router from your smart phone, interaction applications are OUTSTANDING! Reliability is a ten out of ten. To date, this router has not been down once. The fantastic pricing is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: August James

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: It’s not easy to set up and then afterwards, it doesn’t transmit a good signal upstairs. The device we replaced was a rental, modem/router combo. I replaced modem, I bought this router and now we have NO internet. Why change a good thing??? bc I thought I would save money down the road and now I’m paying for internet that I can’t even use. What a rip off.!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Queen Lyrica

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: If you have an apartment or small house, don't spend big dollars on those expensive routers. This router will give you all the performance you need. Very easy set-up, good quality stable signal, nice design and styling. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

product_meta.title: Tenda AC1200 Wireless Wi-Fi Gigabit Smart Router (AC9)
product_meta.description: Color:AC1200 Ultra802.11AC-the next generation of Wi-Fi ac9 comes with the next generation Wi-Fi standard-802.11Ac, 3 times faster than wireless n speed and delivering a combined wireless date transfer rate of up to 1.2 GBPS. With 867mbps wireless speed over the crystal clear 5ghz band and 300mpbs over the 2.4 GHZ band, the ac9 is the superior choice for seamless HD steaming, online gaming and other bandwidth-intensive tasks. Full gigabit wired connections for ultrafast date transfer speed with one gigabit internet port and four gigabit Ethernet ports, speeds can be up to 10x faster than Ethernet connections. The ac9 is a powerful hub to support a robust and extremely fast wired network. External antennas for fully expanded coverage with 2 external dual-band antennas combined with higher quality antenna technology, you can maintain high speeds across greater distances. This provides you with incredible wireless coverage and reliability anyway.
feature_bullets: Supports 802. 11AC, the next generation of Wi-Fi
Simultaneous 2. 4GHz 300Mbps and 5GHz 867Mbps connections for 1. 2Gbps of total available bandwidth
Two external dual band antennas for faster, more reliable wireless performance at greater distances
Manage your network settings easily with the Tenda app
Industry leading 3-year and free 24/7 technical support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars5,123 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
